intro: Podospermum bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored podo, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves that are typically dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and feature two distinct colors, often white and pink, giving it its common name. Podospermum bicolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
